intro: Lampranthus plautus, commonly known as the "Rainbow Plant," is a member of the Aizoaceae family, native to South Africa. It is a succulent shrub that typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring dense clusters of small, colorful flowers in shades of yellow, orange, and red. The plant is known for its striking, showy blooms that appear in late summer to early autumn. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance, it is widely cultivated as an ornamental plant.
